data.title: GWT Reflection: Use switch instead of if-cascade
layer properties of tIDE
GWT Reflection: Fixed getSuperClass to return null for Object.class
data.body:
ClassReflection.getFields(c) returns an error in GWT:

```
Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'java_lang_Class_typeName' of null 
```

This is because of an unchecked access to the superClass in the Type class.

data.title: new method for setting the seed of Random in MathUtils
GWT Reflelction Cache: Check if a class is really instantiable with new ...
data.body:
...operator.

The generated code for newInstance only works for public, empty constructors. isDefaultInstantiable returns true also for protected constructors for which the generated code will not work. 

The new check in isInstantiableWithNewOperator  tests if the empty constructor is public too.

Gwt project stopped compiling after update
data.body:
In gdx.gwt.xml the "utils/Select.java" is not included.
Added it and now I get this error:
   [ERROR] Errors in 'com/badlogic/gdx/utils/JsonReader.java'
      [ERROR] Line 70: The method closeQuietly(Closeable) in the type StreamUtils is not applicable for the arguments (InputStream)
The JsonReader class became unusable in html version.

RoboVM Preferences (java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException)
data.body:
Using the latest nightlies compiled version.

When trying to putInteger to preferences the following exception throws:

Exception in thread "main" java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
    at java.util.AbstractMap.put(AbstractMap.java)
    at org.robovm.cocoatouch.foundation.NSDictionary.put(NSDictionary.java)
    at com.badlogic.gdx.backends.iosrobovm.IOSPreferences.putInteger(IOSPreferences.java)
    at com.colubri.towerdefence.helpers.PreferencesHelper.setMaxTowerLvl(PreferencesHelper.java)
    at com.colubri.towerdefence.TowerDefenceGame.create(TowerDefenceGame.java)
    at com.badlogic.gdx.backends.iosrobovm.IOSGraphics.draw(IOSGraphics.java)
    at com.badlogic.gdx.backends.iosrobovm.IOSGraphics$1.draw(IOSGraphics.java)
    at org.robovm.cocoatouch.uikit.UIView$Callbacks.draw(UIView.java)
    at org.robovm.cocoatouch.uikit.UIApplication.UIApplicationMain(Native Method)
    at org.robovm.cocoatouch.uikit.UIApplication.main(UIApplication.java)
    at com.colubri.towerdefence.RobovmLauncher.main(RobovmLauncher.java)

data.title: A little javadoc fix
data.body: My first contribution!

data.title: MathUtils.random(float range) has poor random distribution
data.body:
https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/blob/master/gdx/src/com/badlogic/gdx/math/MathUtils.java#L159

by it's nature of multiplying by a range, it gives a poor random distrubtion (caused bug in my testing).

I suggest improve the docs, or better yet, deprecate the method.

data.title: Using ShapeRenderer together with Scene/Table leads to missing events
data.body:
Inserting two sliders into two cells of a table row together with a ShapeRenderer attached to the next row, the second slider doesn't react to the mouse, it gets no events at all. Funny enough, putting the sliders in different rows works!

I have a simple demo program to show the problem, but don't know how to attach it here. Please contact me at peter@peter-junglas.de.
     Cheers 
         Peter

data.title: SelectBox should save Objects not Strings
Json - constructor default value with Enum
RoboVM backend, black screen bug
data.body:
Hi LibGDX team!

Ive ported my game from using monotouch backened to robovm, and it runs great! But sometimes the screen becomes black on resuming the game after a couple of hours. First the launcher image shows briefly (if you have launcher images set up-Default.png, Default@2x.png), then its replaced by a black screen. The continues to run with sound but nothing is rendered. Its almost as if the game loses the opengl context.

Resuming the game within a shorter period of time does not produce this issue (even after locking the device), the launcher image does not show in this case. Maybe we need to implement viewDidUnload or didReceiveMemoryWarning?. Im not familiar with iOS though.

Happens on iPad Mini.

Anyway, amazing work on the RoboVM alternative!

data.title: Fix other test shaders
Test shader: dont assume varying is removed
RoboVM: Loading Skin UI -> SerializationException because of missing Classes
data.body:
Using the skin loading mechanism of LibGDX doesn't work for RoboVM, because several styles are not supported, which are throwing exceptions like

Caused by: com.badlogic.gdx.utils.reflect.ReflectionException: Class not found: com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.ui.xyz

I found the following problematic styles:

a) ScrollPane$ScrollPaneStyle
b) CheckBox$CheckBoxStyle
c) List$ListStyle
d) Touchpad$TouchpadStyle
e) Tree$TreeStyle

Probably there are more missing.
